create.description: This creates a new ~l:date~ item in the supplied container - usually a ~l:div|k|browser~ - and initialized with the given values.

date.description: This declares a ~m:<date>~ variable. You can create a new ~m:date~ element with ~l:create~.%0a%0aA ~m:date~ is a compound component consisting of 3 fields, for year, month and day. The component handles its own interactions, adjusting itself for months of different lengths and also for leap years.

set.description: This sets the value of the ~m:date~ component to the timestamp given. Timestamps are the number of seconds since January 1, 1970 (the Unix epoch).
set.examples: set StartDate to now%0aset FinishDate to FutureDate

timestamp of.description: Converts the date currently held by the ~l:date|k~ component to a Unit timestamp.
timestamp of.examples: put the timestamp of IssueDate to SomeDate

date of.description: Converts the date currently held by the ~l:date|k~ component to a text string of the form "{day} {month} {year}", for example "15 July 2014".
date of.examples: put the date of ActionDate into Buffer

create.description: This creates a new ~m:date~ item in the supplied container - usually a ~l:div|k|browser~ - initialized with the given values.

date.description: This declares a ~m:<date>~ variable. You can create a new ~m:date~ element with ~l:create~.
